supporting_spans: Your people have invaded our island. They have stolen away our fields; they have burned our villages.

Listen, continued Kai-Koumou. "Tohonga, the high-priest of Nouï-Atoua, has fallen into the hands of your brothers. He is prisoner of the Pakekas (Europeans). Our god commands us to ransom his life. I would have torn out your heart, I would have hung your companions' heads and yours forever to the stakes of this palisade. But Nouï-Atoua has spoken."
reasoning: Evidence supports: The evidence directly states that Kai-Koumou saw his father ambushed by British musket squad and his mother tattooed a vengeance curse on him.

analysis.claim_text: Born on New Zealand’s North-island east coast to a Maori war-chief father and a priestess mother skilled in herbs and star-reading, he saw his father ambushed by a British musket squad, the body mutilated, the left ear taken as trophy; his mother tattooed a vengeance curse on his chest with ochre.

sub_claims.text: Born on New Zealand’s North-island east coast to a Maori war-chief father and a priestess mother skilled in herbs and star-reading.
Saw his father ambushed by a British musket squad, the body mutilated, the left ear taken as trophy.

analysis.reasoning: Evidence supports: The evidence directly states that Kai-Koumou saw his father ambushed by British musket squad and his mother tattooed a vengeance curse on him.
